intro: Daucus australiae, commonly known as the Australian carrot, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features a taproot that is typically white or yellow in color, similar to that of the common carrot. Its leaves are fern-like, with a distinctive pinnate structure, and it produces small, yellow flowers in umbels. Daucus australiae is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy soils across various regions of Australia.
